business.headline: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged, why its still a win-win situation for homebuyersWhile many homebuyers were hoping for a rate cut, the RBI decision to keep rates steady at 5.25% is not bad news, especially for those who value stability and clear planning.

RBI maintains 5.25% repo rate: What it means for homebuyers and EMIsThe RBI has decided to keep its key interest rate unchanged in its latest policy review. What could this steady stance mean for homebuyers and their monthly loan repayments?

RBI keeps key lending rates unchanged at 5.25% in last MPC of FY26The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept repo rate unchanged at 5.25% in the last meeting for Fy26. The RBI Governor said inflation trends have been supportive of keeping rates unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks continue fall; TCS, TechM down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 216.98 points to 83,097.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.25 points to 25,562.55 as of 9:48 am.

Bitcoin prices hit 16-month low: Will it fall below $60,000?Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, dropped to an intraday low of $60,008.52 during volatile trade. This was the weakest level seen since October 2024

RBI MPC announcement today: Will Governor Sanjay Malhotra reduce repo rate?In its December policy meeting, the Reserve Bank of India had reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points from 5.50% to 5.25%. At the same time, it retained a neutral policy stance.

India-EU trade deal and the gender blind spot in India's trade policyIntegrating gender considerations into trade policy design, implementation, and evaluation is therefore essential—not only to ensure that trade works for women, but to ensure that trade works better overall.

India–Nigeria ties key to shaping a stronger global southBy working closely through diplomatic engagement, trade and cultural cooperation, Musawa believes that both nations can play a leading role in shaping a future where developing countries have a louder voice on the world stage.

Peace, partnerships and progress top agenda for Caribbean nationsSpeaking to India Today at the World Governments Summit, Wheatley and Mitchell highlighted the importance of peace, economic diversification and stronger global partnerships for Caribbean nations.

Bitcoin hovers around $71,000, hits weakest level in about 15 monthsBitcoin fell nearly 2% to around $71,000 on February 5, marking its weakest level in about 15 months. The world's largest cryptocurrency has now lost more than 42% from its October peak of $126,000 last year.

Global conflicts expose decline of international law, says Timor-Leste president President of Timor-Leste José Ramos-Horta said the world is witnessing the steady breakdown of global systems that were created to protect peace, human rights, and fair international trade.

India, Gulf Cooperation Council agree to restart talks on long-pending free trade dealThe move formally revives negotiations between India and the six-nation bloc after a long gap and signals a renewed push to deepen economic cooperation.
Sensex ends 504 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; Eternal down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 503.76 points to close at 83,313.93, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.20 points to end at 25,642.80.

Sensex down 500 points: Why is stock market falling today?At 2:30 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 569.43 points at 83,248.26. The NSE Nifty50 also declined, falling 164.50 points to 25,611.50. Both benchmark indices were down by over half a percent, showing clear pressure across the market.

AI and policy are redefining digital lifestyles, say global tech leadersAl Shamsi said telecom companies are no longer just service providers focused on speed and coverage. They are evolving into broader technology platforms that support consumer, enterprise and government services.

A system upgrade led to a criminal tax notice. How Budget 2026 changes thatA routine system upgrade or staff reshuffle should not land a business in criminal trouble. Yet, under earlier tax rules, even genuine operational delays could trigger prosecution. Budget 2026 aims to fix this by easing penalties for procedural lapses.

Competition watchdog orders probe into IndiGo after mass flight cancellationsIn a 16-page order, the Competition Commission of India (CCI) said that IndiGo, which holds a dominant position in the domestic aviation market, may have abused its strength by cancelling a large number of flights.

Silver ETFs sink up to 15%, gold ETFs remain relatively steadySilver ETFs witnessed aggressive one-day selling, with losses ranging from over 10% to nearly 15% during morning trade. The fall was much steeper than what was seen in gold ETFs.

A slow reset, not a shock: What the EU-India FTA means for liquor companiesThe EU-India FTA is not an immediate disruption to India's domestic alcohol industry but a calibrated strategic shift that will gradually reshape competition, pushing domestic producers to evolve through premiumisation, enforcement-backed regulation, and long-term adaptability rather than relying on tariff protection.

Sensex falls 400 points: Are IT stocks down today, do investors need to panic?At around 10 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 448.57 points at 83,369.12. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped, falling 144.95 points to 25,631.05. The fall was close to half a percent, showing a clear pause after the recent rally.

entertainment.headline: BLACKPINK's Lisa to lead Notting Hill-inspired rom-com in Hollywood debut Lisa of BLACKPINK is set to star in a new Netflix romantic comedy inspired by Notting Hill. The film marks her first solo lead role in an English-language movie and a significant step in her acting career.

Vishal Jethwa joins Shakti Shalini opposite Aneet Padda: Sources Vishal Jethwa has signed on to star opposite Aneet Padda in the upcoming film Shakti Shalini. The female-led action drama is set to begin shooting in March and promises a blend of powerful storytelling and intense action.

FIR against Manoj Bajpayee's Ghooskhor Pandat after Yogi Adityanath's directive Authorities in Uttar Pradesh have filed an FIR at Lucknow's Hazratganj Police Station against the director and team of the upcoming film Ghooskhor Pandat, after orders from Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, citing concerns about social harmony.

Nick Jonas says marrying Priyanka Chopra tops his advice to younger self Nick Jonas shares the one thing he'd tell his younger self and it involves Priyanka Chopra. His emotional reflections reveal how much life has changed since.

Suniel Shetty dismisses reports linking Sanki delay to Ahan Shetty's entourage Actor Suniel Shetty recently countered rumours suggesting his son Ahan Shetty's alleged high entourage expenses led to the postponement of the film Sanki. He clarified his family's professional approach and Ahan's recent career developments.

Malayalam actor Maniyanpilla Raju's car rams bike outside club, he flees spot Malayalam actor Maniyanpilla Raju was involved in a hit-and-run accident in Thiruvananthapuram last night. Two people on the two-wheeler were injured and hospitalised.

Smriti-Palaash were madly in love for 6 years: Actor who attended pre-wedding bash Actor Nandish Sandhu, who attended the pre-wedding celebrations of Palaash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana, described the couple as 'madly in love' in the years leading up to the called-off ceremony, while providing insight into the events that unfolded.

Kristen Stewart considers leaving US, says Trump era limits her freedom Kristen Stewart opens up about feeling trapped in the US under Trump's second term. Why is she now looking to leave and where could she go next? Find out.

Riya Shibu's Delulu in Sarvam Maya: The ghost who heals, not haunts Sarvam Maya features Riya Shibu as Delulu, an unusual friendly ghost who helps heal grief. The film redefines horror with warmth, love and an emotional closure.

Neeraj Pandey responds to Ghooskhor Pandat title row, pulls promotional materials Following backlash over the title of his upcoming Netflix film Ghooskhor Pandat, Neeraj Pandey has released an official statement explaining the intent behind the film and responding to the concerns expressed online.

Anushka Sharma reacts as Smriti Mandhana leads RCB to second WPL title Anushka Sharma reacts as RCB Women make history again in a dramatic WPL final. What made this victory so special for the Bengaluru side? Read more to find out.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 7: Rani's film struggles, earns Rs 26 crore in 1st week Rani Mukerji's cop drama Mardaani 3 saw modest earnings after a week in theatres, with audience turnout and daily revenues reflecting a slow trend.

Did Britney Spears admit fear of her family amid long personal battle? Britney Spears makes a chilling confession about her family that's left fans concerned. What's behind her fear years after her conservatorship ended? Read more to find out.

Rakkasapuradol review: Strong writing lifts Raj B Shetty-led murder mysteryRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Rakkasapuradol movie review: Ravi Saranga's Rakkasapuradol starring Raj B Shetty, is an intelligently written murder mystery, mixing elements of mental health conditions like Schizophrenia, supernatural connections and compelling performances.

With Love review: Cute romance with interesting ideas, marred by flat screenplayRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 With Love movie review: Directed by Madhan, With Love is a romantic drama featuring Abishan Jeevinth and Anaswara Rajan. The cute love story is packed with interesting ideas, but marred by a flat screenplay.

Did Brooklyn Beckham just erase his 'dad' tattoo as the family feud simmers? Brooklyn Beckham made a quiet but telling change that's sparked fresh questions about his family rift. What does it really mean for the Beckhams?

Nakkul Mehta says his first Telugu film never released | Exclusive Actor Nakkul Mehta discussed his unconventional path into the entertainment industry, sharing insights into his early beginnings, challenges faced, and the shift in his perspective on success.

Prabhas' The Raja Saab gets extended OTT cut following mixed reviews Streaming platform JioHotstar has announced that The Raja Saab will feature an extended cut in its OTT release, following calls from viewers to include scenes missing from the theatrical version.

Guy Ritchie's Young Sherlock to premiere globally on Prime Video in March. Details Prime Video will launch all episodes of the new series Young Sherlock, directed by Guy Ritchie and starring Hero Fiennes Tiffin, in over 240 countries and territories in March.

general news.headline: H5N1 outbreak in Chennai, hundreds of crows found dead; government issues advisoryHundreds of crows have been found dead across Chennai, with subsequent laboratory tests confirming the presence of the H5N1 avian influenza virus.

We'll take strict action: Delhi Police denies surge in missing girls casesDelhi Police has dismissed viral claims of a surge in missing girls, alleging paid promotion behind the panic after reports claimed a massive surge in missing people cases in the national capital in January.

Gave his number: Artist recalls Deepak Chopra's late-night invite when she was 16A viral allegation against wellness guru Deepak Chopra has sparked widespread debate on power and accountability in spiritual circles. The controversy intensified with resurfaced emails linking Chopra to Jeffrey Epstein, drawing global attention.

Pak plays cricket politics, drops it for dollars from India-born World Bank headPakistan has decided to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. However, on the other hand, it has rolled out the red carpet for Indian-origin World Bank chief Ajay Banga. Pakistan's mehman nawazi for Banga was not for nothing. We explain the reasons behind it.

As Mao marched, India won Tawang without firing even a shot. Thanks to Bob KhatingIn the eastern Himalayas, Tawang used to be a loosely administered frontier region even after the 1914 Shimla Convention placed it in the British-Indian territory. Mao Zedong's annexation of Tibet in 1950 rang alarm bells for India. Then, Major Bob Khathing Ralengnao, a Manipuri Naga officer, achieved what the British could not. He hoisted the Indian Tricolour in Tawang on February 14, 1951, and integrated it with India, without firing a single shot.

Madras High Court upholds Rs 1.5 crore tax penalty on actor-politician VijayThe Madras High Court has upheld a Rs 1.5 crore penalty on actor-turned-politician Vijay for alleged undisclosed income of Rs 15 crore during 2015-16. The court ruled the Income Tax Department's notice was issued within the prescribed time limit, allowing the penalty to stand.

China reveals space aircraft carrier. Superweapon or propaganda?China has unveiled a concept for a flying aircraft carrier that would hover at the edge of space. The idea suggests it could launch unmanned jets and hypersonic missiles. Many are calling it propaganda. Even if the flying aircraft carrier comes to life, it will take Beijing at least three decades to build it.

Sisters' Korean awe, father's Rs 2-crore debt: Ghaziabad suicide probe deepensThe central piece of evidence in the probe into the suicide of three minor sisters in Ghaziabad becomes a nine-page pocket diary recovered by the police, which the sisters described as their 'true life story'.

Heartbreak is their canvas: Delhi Capitals paint pain like Picasso in WPL historyWPL 2026: Delhi Capitals lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by six wickets in the WPL final on Thursday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. Jemimah Rodrigues-led DC became the first team in the tournament's history to win the Eliminator but fell short of lifting the WPL title.

H5N1 flu confirmed in Chennai: What is it, and can it spread to humans?An advisory has been issued to the public as health authorities move quickly to contain the outbreak and prevent further transmission.

India once rejected this Balochistan port. China controls it todayGwadar port in Pakistan's Balochistan is at the centre of unrest, geopolitics and Chinese influence. Once ruled by Oman and later offered to India, this strategic coastal town is now operated by China for decades, raising questions about sovereignty, local anger and South Asia's missed geopolitical turns.

Virat Kohli writes special message to Smriti Mandhana after RCB's 2nd WPL titleWPL: Royal Challengers Bengaluru became the first ever team in the history to hold the IPL and WPL titles together. After the historic feat, Virat Kohli penned a special message for RCB women's team captain Smriti Mandhana to congratulate the team.

Video: Biker blocks car, vandalises it and abuses techie in Bengaluru road rageRoad rage incidents continue to plague the city, with yet another case reported on Friday. A motorcyclist allegedly abused, threatened and vandalised a car driven by Aditya, who was on his way to work from Nelamangala to Manyata Tech Park.

What reportedly began as a minor traffic-related issue soon escalated when the biker allegedly blocked the car, broke one of its mirrors, damaged parts of the vehicle and hurled abuses using obscene language. The Madanayakanahalli police have registered a case and launched an investigation. Authorities have urged motorists to remain calm and avoid confrontations on the road.

Punjab AAP leader killed outside gurdwara, shot 5 times in broad daylightAAP leader Lucky Oberoi was shot multiple times outside a Gurdwara Sahib in Jalandhar's Model Town by two bike-borne men. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him brought dead.

Chinese scientists discover 207 volcanoes bubbling under AntarcticaA China-led team has archived 207 volcanoes hidden under Antarctic ice. This breakthrough helps scientists understand how geothermal heat affects global sea levels.

AI so good at coding, coders now have to look for some other career: Sridhar VembuAI seems to be getting better at coding almost everyday. After Anthropic's latest Claude Opus 4.6 model created a C compiler from scratch, Zoho cofounder Sridhar Vembu believes that coders might want to look at other career options.

Miss you: Pune man livestreams plea for wife and daughter, then jumps to deathThe man climbed atop a water tank and went live on Facebook, where he expressed his anguish over his separation and his love for his wife and daughter, before jumping to his death.

Do you think VR is just for gamers? It's helping India's elderly healHandcrafted ByOur Editors When people think of VR gadgets, gaming and recreation usually come to mind. But VR is also being used to support the elderly's cognitive and physical health.

Malayalam actor Maniyanpilla Raju's car rams bike outside club, he flees spotMalayalam actor Maniyanpilla Raju was involved in a hit-and-run accident in Thiruvananthapuram last night. Two people on the two-wheeler were injured and hospitalised.

Rajpal Yadav surrenders in Tihar jail after no relief in cheque-bounce casesJustice Swarana Kanta Sharma, while ordering Rajpal Yadav to surrender immediately, strongly criticised him for failing to comply with the court's earlier directive to surrender on February 4.

Diplomacy or dagger? US pushes Iran to talks as warships close in on GulfThe US and Iran have agreed to hold talks in Oman on Friday, officials said, despite differences over Washington's push to include Iran's missile programme and Tehran's demand to limit discussions to nuclear issues.

sports.headline: Australia hit by injury crisis, after Cummins, Hazlewood ruled out of T20 WC Australia are in a major injury crisis right ahead of the T20 World Cup. After the exit of Pat Cummins, fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the tournament.

Mandhana reveals how RCB took the Kohli way en route to title no.2 in WPL RCB captain Smriti Mandhana revealed that the one key thing that helped the side to their second WPL trophy. Mandhana in her post-match address, revealed that RCB had put a lot of work behind the scenes.

Heartbreak is their canvas: Delhi Capitals paint pain like Picasso in WPL history WPL 2026: Delhi Capitals lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by six wickets in the WPL final on Thursday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. Jemimah Rodrigues-led DC became the first team in the tournament's history to win the Eliminator but fell short of lifting the WPL title.

Virat Kohli writes special message to Smriti Mandhana after RCB's 2nd WPL title WPL: Royal Challengers Bengaluru became the first ever team in the history to hold the IPL and WPL titles together. After the historic feat, Virat Kohli penned a special message for RCB women's team captain Smriti Mandhana to congratulate the team.

U19 World Cup final: India eye record-extending 6th title, favourites vs England U19 World Cup: India and England are set to lock horns in the grand finale on Friday, February 6. In the semi-final on Wednesday, India beat Afghanistan by seven wickets with a record run-chase in the tournament's history.

Yuzi Chahal tired of endless social media rumours: I know who I really am Yuzvendra Chahal opens up on social media rumours, online trolling and fan wars, saying he ignores the noise and trusts his family and close friends.

Smriti Mandhana has gone through a lot, this win is for her: Shreyanka Patil WPL 2026 final: Shreyanka Patil dedicated RCB's historic second WPL title victory to Smriti Mandhana for leading the side once again after the personal setbacks she faced before the tournament.

RCB script historic chase to clinch 2nd title as DC stumble again in final Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) scripted history by chasing down the highest total in WPL to clinch their second title. Smriti Mandhana led from the front with her innings of 87 (41) as RCB chased down 204 in 19.4 overs to beat Delhi Capitals by six wickets in the final.

Sri Lanka urges Pakistan to reconsider India boycott, flags heavy losses: Report T20 World Cup 2026: Sri Lanka Cricket has reportedly urged the PCB to reconsider boycotting the India match, warning of heavy financial and tourism losses, with the marquee fixture at risk of being called off.

India can only lose T20 World Cup on it's own, no team can beat them: Yuzvendra Chahal India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that India are firm favourites to win the T20 World Cup 2026 and that only their own mistakes could lead to them losing in the tournament. India will begin their campaign against the USA on February 7 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Gautam Gambhir has changed team's milestone-obsessed mindset: Suryakumar Yadav India captain Suryakumar Yadav praised head coach Gautam Gambhir for prioritising team goals over personal milestones. The India captain sakid that the shift has fuelled India's dominant run in T20 cricket and boosted team unity.

India ready to play Pakistan in T20 World Cup, will travel to Colombo: SuryakumarT20 World Cup 2026: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the Men in Blue will travel to Colombo for the February 15 match, despite Pakistan threatening a boycott. Suryakumar said the matter is beyond his control, adding that even the International Cricket Council finds it difficult to intervene when decisions are driven by the Pakistan government.

Pak will make a U-turn on India boycott stance after February 12: Chetan SharmaFormer India pacer Chetan Sharma expects Pakistan to reverse their boycott of the India match after the Bangladesh elections. The Pakistan government have denied permission to their cricket team to play against India.

Mustafizur heads to PSL after shock IPL exit, to earn 77 per cent lessMustafizur Rahman has signed with Lahore Qalandars for PSL 11 after his IPL release by KKR, agreeing to a deal worth about Rs 2 crore, nearly 77 per cent lower than his IPL contract.

Sunil Gavaskar backs Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for 2027 ODI World CupSunil Gavaskar did not think twice when he backed both Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to play the 2027 ODI World Cup. Speaking at India Today's Salaam Cricket 2026, Gavaskar backed the idea of having India's favourite duo for one last push for the ODI crown. "Virat and Kohli will definitely play ODI World Cup 2027. They've been performing well. Even if the ODI are six months later, they will continue practising and stay in touch with the game. Their experience is of utmost importance to the team," he said.

Dancing with joy: Gavaskar's promise to Suryakumar Yadav if India defend T20 crownSunil Gavaskar has promised India captain Suryakumar Yadav a joyful dance if the team successfully defend their T20 World Cup crown, saying nothing moves him more than seeing India lift a trophy.

WPL Final Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru win 2nd title in dramatic fashionWPL 2026, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB-W) vs Delhi Capitals (DC-W) Live Score: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have done it again, leaving Delhi Capitals in the dust to win their second Women's Premier League title.

Will Pakistan play India in T20 World Cup semi final or final? Captain revealsPakistan captain Salman Agha has said that they will have to seek the government's permission to face India in the semi-final or final of the T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan government has denied permission to its players to play against India in the group stage game.

Anurag Thakur gets relief as Supreme Court lifts nine-year BCCI banThe Supreme Court has lifted the nine-year ban on Anurag Thakur, allowing him to participate in BCCI affairs after noting the ban was not meant to be lifelong and citing his unconditional apology.

Uncertainty over India vs Pakistan match not good for players: Ishant SharmaFormer India bowler Ishant Sharma has expressed concern for players amid the uncertainty of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match. The ongoing boycott threat by Pakistan could impact players' preparations and tournament dynamics.

Be the same person no matter what happens: Rishabh Pant reveals Rahul Dravid's advicePant, who flourished under Dravid across formats, said one piece of advice from the Indian legend has stayed with him.

"I think the key is not thinking about it too much and not dwelling on it. There's one really good line I learnt from Rahul (Dravid) bhai. He always told me one thing: 'Rishabh, no matter what happens, try to be the same person when you score a hundred and when you score a zero,'" Pant said.

"I think, as an athlete, that's the hardest thing to do — to remain who you are. Emotions sometimes get the better of you, but that line always stays with me. So personally, I try that. Whether I score zero or a hundred, I want to be the same guy. Maybe when I get out, it hurts more. I don't enjoy scoring runs as much as I feel the pain of getting out," the wicketkeeper-batter concluded.

Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat: We are ready to playT20 World Cup: India's T20I captain, Suryakumar Yadav, remained firm that their plans do not change considering Pakistan's boycott of their group-stage clash. He said that they would prepare for the game regardless of Pakistan's stance.

Dravid's student, now Abhishek's fan: Rishabh Pant on batting mavericksRishabh Pant has revealed his admiration for two batting mavericks - Rahul Dravid and Abhishek Sharma. Speaking on India Today's Salaam Cricket, Pant revealed how one of Dravid's advises will stay with him lifelong.

Salaam Cricket Highlights: India favourites, says Gavaskar. Wasan disagreesSalaam Cricket 2026, T20 World Cup Highlights: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar led a star-studded list of cricketers who spoke about Indian cricket and the upcoming T20 World Cup. Most of them said India are the firm favourites to defend the crown, but former bowler Atul Wasan backed New Zealand to win big.

Thank you, Pakistan: Bangladesh reveals big cricket nexus against IndiaBangladesh's sports adviser Asif Nazrul thanked Pakistan for backing Dhaka's boycott of the T20 World Cup, after Islamabad decided to skip its match against India in Colombo. A day earlier, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif publicly justified the move as standing "completely" with Bangladesh. This exposed how both governments made cricket a theatre of a political engagement against India.

Beyond Suryakumar Yadav. List of Indian-origin captains in T20 World CupT20 World Cup 2026: It is not just the Indian team that will have a captain from India in the T20 World Cup. The mega event on Indian and Sri Lankan soil is set to witness several Indian-origin players leading their respective associate teams.

Tilak Varma gets angry at Arshdeep Singh: Don't take videos without permissionT20 World Cup: India batter Tilak Varma got angry at Arshdeep Singh at the end of the team's warm-up game against South Africa. In the dressing room, Tilak told Arshdeep to not film him without permission.

Has Samson lost opener's battle to Kishan? Aakash Chopra gives his verdictT20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra said that Ishan Kishan cemented his place for the opener's slot with his 53-run knock against South Africa in the warm-up match on Wednesday in Navi Mumbai.

I quite like it: Hussain backs Bangladesh, Pakistan over World Cup boycottNasser Hussain has lambasted the ICC and the BCCI over the ongoing uncertainty in the cricketing world. Nasser says that he quite likes the fact that the board stood up for their players.

Delhi look to break final curse, aim for 2024 revenge in battle of best friendsWPL 2026 Final, RCB vs DC Preview: In the battle of best friends, Jemimah Rodrigues' Delhi Capitals will be up against Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the summit clash on Thursday in Vadodara.

Time to stand up to BCCI, 400 million now on one side: Ex-Pak cricket chiefT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today, former Pakistan Cricket Board chief Najam Sethi said Pakistan is now standing up to BCCI by announcing the boycott of their game against India. Sethi said the ICC is run by people in the BCCI and Pakistan are willing to let go off short-term financial gains to end the bullying of the global cricket body.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
